Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2011 09:02AM - edited Dec 3, 2011 09:03AM by slanderson At 41, I had one period after about a year and then another after about another year and nothing since about 4 years. Weird thing is that the month long cycle lasted several months. Actual period part just a few days, but it sure was nice to be free of the hot flashes. Who knew how important hormones were to how you feel.

Posts.Content: Nov 28, 2011 10:49PM slanderson wrote: I just saw this topic and should have read further before I started a new one. My eyebrows and lashes we're much finer and lighter after chemo, even 2 years out. I found a cosmetic tattoo artist. She did my eyeliner so my lashes look thicker and my brows. I got sick of penciling them in. You have to find someone who specializes in permanent makeup. It really is an art. But my brows really look natural! Should have done it years ago. It's pricey, $850 for each- liner and brows but only one time. Thought I would shareüòç

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2007 12:52PM slanderson wrote: Here's what I did per my surgeon and I think it was the best for minimizing the pain. I had my port put in the day before my first chemo. That way the surgeon can put the needle in while you are under anesthesia. You go home and sleep with the needle in and a big bandage over it. That way the next day when you go in for your first chemo, they don't have to access it, if you will. They don't have to push the needle in as it's already in. All they have to do is give you the treatment and then take it out. Then you have 3 weeks (or I did) to have it heal before the next time you take a treatment. It worked for me. Good Luck! Shannon
